Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit a game-ending infield single with one out in the 11th inning and the New York Yankees outlasted the Kansas City Royals for a 4-3 victory
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said 'This is a big series win for us against a really good club over there that threw a lot of good pitching at us.'
Matt Quatraro said 'It was a tense game, it was tight, it was well pitched on both sides.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York Yankees increased their advantage in the AL East to 1 1/2 games over Baltimore.
The game was tied in the 10th inning before the Yankees took the lead.
The Kansas City Royals fell 4 1/2 games behind first-place Cleveland in the AL Central.
Others: Juan Soto launched a go-ahead homer in the sixth for the Yankees.
Salvador Perez hit a tying sacrifice fly off Clay Holmes in the seventh and started an impressive double play to end the bottom half.
